page.title: 17ONE DAY GREENHALGH/ROSEACRE
page.content: A typical day in the life of an average housewife is as follows. Rises at 7.15am, prepares breakfast for husband and two schoolboy sons. After clearing up the chaos left by the above, leaves for work at 8.40. Cycles several miles to part-time work as a basic education teacher at Kirkham Open Prison. After pub lunch with colleagues returns home. Spends afternoon doing housework, gardening, sewing, teaching preparation, or doing secretarial work for local WI. Spends time with sons who return from schook at 4pm and the family share a meal at 6pm. The evening may be spent at a meeting of the WI, church womens' group, sons' school PTFA, sons' scout group executive, or Scottish Dancing or relaxing at home.
